etymologies: 1930s; earliest use found in Science News

definitions: A device for viewing microfilms, microfiches, or other microforms, in which an enlarged image of part of the microform is projected on to a translucent screen by an internal projector (now rare).
a program or application that renders the text of an electronic document into speech, Braille, etc., especially as an aid for users with a visual impairment.
